questions.question: Which of the following could cause shock?

choices.answer: A burn
A wound that is bleeding heavily
anaphylaxis
All can cause shock

questions.question: You think that a person has a head, neck or spinal injury.  What should you do?

choices.answer: Remove the person's motorcycle helmet.
Keep person in the position found until EMS arrives.
Put the person in the recovery position.
Have the person shake head from side to side.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?

choices.answer: A person with a concussion always loses consciousness.
You have to be hit hard to sustain a concussion.
A concussion is a type of traumatic brain injury.
Someone with a concussion can resume activity quickly.

questions.question: What should you do for someone having an asthma attack?

choices.answer: Have person sit and take deep breaths.
Use quick-relief meds and call 911 if no improvement.
Give person a cool drink.
Help person use his/her epi pen.

questions.question: Which of the following could be signs of a stroke?

choices.answer: Drooping on one side of the face.
Trouble with speech.
One arm drifts downward when both arms are lifted.
All are signs.

questions.question: How can you help someone who is showing symptoms of heat stroke?

choices.answer: Drink large amounts of cool water quickly.
Get the person out of the heat and into a cooler place.
Immerse the person up to the neck in ice water.
Call 911 or the designated emergency number.

questions.question: What should you do to help a student who burned her hand in the lunchroom?

choices.answer: Run it under cool water for at least 10 minutes.
Cover the burn loosely with a dry sterile dressing.
Remove her from the burn source.
All of the above.

questions.question: The sudden illness caused by a blockage of blood flow to the brain is called _____________.

choices.answer: Heart attack
Heat stroke
stroke
Diabetic emergency

questions.question: How much sugar can be given in a diabetic emergency.  Person can swallow and is responsive.

choices.answer: 5 grams
10-15 grams
15-20 grams
25 grams

questions.question: Which of the following should you do when caring for a seizure?

choices.answer: Put something between the person's teeth.
Remove nearby objects that might cause injury.
Try to hold the person down.
Don't do any of these.

questions.question: You're giving FA to a person w/a muscle, bone or joint injury.  EMS was called.  Now what?

choices.answer: Bandage the injured body part.
Splint the injury to immobilize it.
Apply cold if tolerable.  Watch for signs of shock.
All of the previous.

questions.question: A person is showing signs of a heart attack.  What should you do first?

choices.answer: Have the person chew two low-dose aspirin tablets.
Begin CPR
Put person in a comfortable position, loosen tight clothing.
Call 911 or the designated emergency number.

questions.question: When using direct pressure to control a non-life-threatening bleeding open wound, you should...

choices.answer: Remove dressing every minute to see if the bleeding stopped.
Remove & replace dressings saturated with blood.
Use a hemostatic dressing.
Add more dressings, continue direct pressure & bandage wound

questions.question: In which situation would it be appropriate to us a tourniquet?

choices.answer: The victim has a bleeding chest wound.
The victim has a severe head wound.
There are multiple people with life-threatening injuries.
The victim has a non-life threatening open wound on the arm.

questions.question: Which statement is true about anaphylaxis?

choices.answer: Victim may have trouble breathing and go into shock.
It's important to act quickly when showing signs.
The effects can be stopped/slowed by using epinephrine.
All statements are true.
